item.title: oprah's legacy: success and sense of self
item.description: if oprah proves anything, it's that people don't always know what they want until the right person gives it to them.

item.title: 2011 nba finals a rematch of 2006 won by the miami heat
item.description: the miami heat won their first nba title by defeating the dallas mavericks in the 2006 nba finals. the 2011 finals is a rematch.

item.title: playoffs | heat 96, bulls 85: back in miami, heat is halfway to the finals
item.description: chris bosh continued to make atonement for any misgivings in a trying, acclimating season, finishing with a game-high 34 points as the heat took a 2-1 series lead over the bulls.

item.title: atlantic hurricane season "above normal": noaa
item.description: the 2011 atlantic hurricane season will be "above normal", spawning six to 10 hurricanes of which around half could become major, the government's weather agency forecast on thursday.

item.description: jury selection began on friday in the trial of a cleveland man accused of killing 11 women.

item.title: obama likely to announce re-election bid next week

item.title: new york city to consider banning fast-food toys

item.description: president barack obama declared himself a candidate for re-election in 2012 on monday, jumping ahead of a slow-starting republican field and hoping an economic recovery will boost his case for a new term.

item.description: a prominent organization of the fiscally conservative tea party on wednesday made its first endorsement in the 2012 campaign, backing nebraska republican attorney general jon bruning for senate.

item.description: general motors is vastly increasing capacity at the plant that makes the chevrolet volt plug-in extended-range electric car.

item.title: mike campbell, zimbabwean farmer who fought land seizure, dies at 78
item.description: mr. campbell won a 2008 court ruling to stop the seizure of his land, after he was severely beaten by loyalists of president robert mugabe. he lost the farm anyway.
